blog.description: I reblog a lot so check my 'mygifs' tag for my gif sets. Feel free to ask questions or leave comments! Also, please do not repost my gif sets! Reblog is better! This blog is not Endgame friendly, or more specifically not Steve's ending friendly.

summary: Quick note
title: Quick note
body:
I just wanted to let everyone know that starting today, this will be a spoiler-free blog for Captain Marvel and Avengers: Endgame.

If it hasn’t been released via official means, i.e. magazine pics, official stills, trailers, tv spots, etc, you won’t find it here.

I’m even cutting out the speculation discussions I post occasionally.

I just want to go into these movies unspoiled and experience it first hand. (I’m seeing Captain Marvel tonight). I had Infinity War spoiled and it’s just not as much fun. So, I’m also making my blog safe for people to come to to avoid spoilers.

So, I have the following tags blacklisted: spoilers and endgame spoilers. Are there any other tags other blogs are using that I need to block?

summary: Details on the Avengers: Endgame Footage Shown at Disney's Annual Shareholders Meeting
title: Details on the Avengers: Endgame Footage Shown at Disney's Annual Shareholders Meeting
body:
Details on the #AvengersEndgame Footage Shown at Disney’s Annual Shareholders Meeting

This morning Disney held their 2019 Annual Shareholders Meeting, and as usual they showed some very cool things to those who attended. In addition to the first footage from Star Wars: Episode IX and the Avatar sequels, they showed off a clip of Avengers: Endgame to their shareholders in attendance.

Scott Ladewig on Twitter was in attendance, and he detailed what they showed:

The Avengers Endgame…

summary: 'Road to Avengers: Endgame' Art Book Coming April 23rd
title: 'Road to Avengers: Endgame' Art Book Coming April 23rd
body:
‘Road to #AvengersEndgame’ Art Book Coming April 23rd

In addition to there being an art book for Avengers: Endgame like all other MCU movies at some point long after the release of the movie, there will be a “Road to” book coming right before release.

Marvel did the same thing for Avengers: Infinity War last year, as the wait for the actual art book for that movie was so long to avoid spoilers; so the same thing will happen this year for Endgameon…

blog.name: artemisegeria
blog.title: This Is Not The Endgame

tags: i have no one to fangirl with in real life
so the internet gets my excited ramblings
i have been waiting too long
summary: 34.5 Hours and Counting
title: 34.5 Hours and Counting
body:
I’m seeing Captain Marvel in about 34.5 hours! 

I find it kind of funny that when I first started thinking about Captain Marvel I was basically only interested in it to see how it fit into Endgame. As more information and material was released, I became more excited about it in its own right. I still think it looks like a good movie, but now my excitement is back to being focused on what clues CM will give to Endgame.

I think it’s because I have been desperate to find out how Endgame resolves since last April. There have been peaks and valleys in my interest because its difficult to maintain that level of excitement/dread for a whole year. But now I have waited through more than ten months, and April 26 is getting so close that I can almost taste it. 

The fact that I still have no clue what direction they are heading in for Endgame also helps. I think I’ve heard all the biggest, most popular theories, like time travel, multiple realities, quantum realm, the chess metaphor, etc. But I have no idea how those theories would actually be implemented in the movie. None of the theories strike me as the indisputable path that the movie will follow, though many seem plausible to various degrees.

So I hope Captain Marvel will give some insight, along with being good in its own right.

summary: Seriously? Do I have to say this every time a Marvel movie comes out?
body:
Seriously? Do I have to say this every time a Marvel movie comes out?

If you aren’t going to tag your spoilers properly, or if you’re going to be a DICK and post them but tag them wrong just to mess with people then you need to just leave. Honestly. Everyone is waiting with bated breath for Endgame, and we know that every movie has an end credit scene, and with Captain Marvel being the only movie standing between us all and Endgame, it’s a no brainer. TAG YOUR SPOILERS. TAG YOUR POSTS. Some people like being spoiled, that’s cool and totally their prerogative. But others, myself included, don’t enjoy it. People blacklist certain tags so they aren’t spoiled, and if you are going to go so far as to mess with that, my god that is just so blatantly rude. So please. Don’t be a dick. That’s all.

summary: 'Captain Marvel' Review: Middle Tier MCU Film Still Delights
title: 'Captain Marvel' Review: Middle Tier MCU Film Still Delights
body:
‘Captain Marvel’ Review: Middle Tier MCU Film Still Delights

If anything is true after 21 films set in the Marvel Cinematic Universe, it’s that Kevin Feige and Marvel Studios know exactly what they’re doing. They are incapable of making a bad movie. And as comic book movie fan I truly cherish that fact and look forward to their latest work two or three times a year.

But if we’re being realistic, not every single one of these can top the one that came…

summary: A friend pointed out that the dissolving in Infinity War is very similar to the dissolving in Jumanji welcome to the Jungle when...
body:
A friend pointed out that the dissolving in Infinity War is very similar to the dissolving in Jumanji welcome to the Jungle when they enter the game. 

So we’ve determined that in Endgame, we’re going to discover that all the people who dissolved in the Snap, really entered Jumanji. And there, they’ll discover The Rock and learn that he is the seventh and most powerful infinity stone. They’ll bring him back and the Rock will defeat Thanos.

blog.name: englishmansdcc
blog.title: An Englishman In San Diego
blog.description: ‘An Englishman In San Diego’ - an unofficial fan site and news resource for the San Diego Comic-Con, also covering news, updates, reviews and commentary for Con-related pop culture – all from an Englishman’s perspective.

summary: Captain Marvel: The Cat Did What!?
title: Captain Marvel: The Cat Did What!?
body:
Captain Marvel: The Cat Did What!? - movie review of @CaptainMarvel by @SamanthaMaybe. #CaptainMarvel #MarvelCinematicUniverse

Photo courtesy of @AlanahSees, taken at Captain Marvel world premiere March 4th, 2019

After attending a press screening of Captain Marvel on Monday, I felt like I could do anything. I was full of joy and just could not stop smiling. This is a welcome feeling for me, after some other Marvel Studios origin films left me cold. I think Captain Marvelpresents a unique and powerful origin story that…

tags: How to Train Your Dragon: The Hidden World
The LEGO Movie 2: The Second Part
summary: Weekly Box Office Work-Up
title: Weekly Box Office Work-Up
body:
Weekly Box Office Work-Up

It was a tight race for the top spot at the box office this weekend between Tyler Perry’s A Madea Family Funeral and How to Train Your Dragon: The Hidden World. The victory ultimately went to How to Train Your Dragonwith an estimated $30 million haul. That makes for a 45.4% drop from last week, which is slightly ahead of its predecessor, which dropped 50% in its second frames. Domestically, the…

summary: r/marvelstudios - Avengers Compound 2/2
title: r/marvelstudios - Avengers Compound 2/2
excerpt: 328 votes and 128 comments so far on Reddit
description: I am too excited about this LEGO set for AVENGERS: ENDGAME. Because it has Nebula. I have definitely seen Tony, Cap and Hulk included in sets when they aren’t in the scene in the movie (just to sell toys, I think). But I don’t imagine Nebula is a topseller for them so what I concluded from this is “Nebula fights Thanos and kills him the end.” Carol helps and her hair looks great.

summary: So I saw on @tisfan 's ask post about the adorable Tony Stark/Iron Man itty bittys I learned they were at Hallmark. So I decided...
body:
So I saw on @tisfan ’s ask post about the adorable Tony Stark/Iron Man itty bittys I learned they were at Hallmark. So I decided to go down their to get my niece a birthday card and saw the Tony itty bitty and decided to take him home.

Best $7.00 I ever spent. Guess who’ll be acompanying me to Avengers: Endgame in April?.
